title: Armed and dangerous shooting suspect, 61, escapes from Kentucky jail through air ducts
text:
Creadell Hubbard, 61, escaped from the Christian County jail Monday

A shooting suspect is on the loose after escaping from a Kentucky jail's air ducts.

Hopkinsville police issued an alert for a 61-year-old Creadell Hubbard who escaped from the Christian County jail Monday.

According to police, Hubbard is the suspect in a previous shooting and was being held at the jail on other charges.

They say he has a violent criminal history including charges of fleeing, possession of a firearm and possession of handgun by a convicted felon.

Hubbard escaped between 4pm and 10pm Monday through the jail's heating and cooling system.

He is described as 5 feet 10 inches tall, weighing 195 pounds with black and gray hair.

Authorities say Hubbard should be considered armed and dangerous.

Anyone with information on his whereabouts is urged to contact Kentucky State Police Post 2 at 270-676-3313 or 911.
description: Creadell Hubbard, 61, escaped from the Christian County jail Monday in Hopkinsville, Kentucky, by crawling through the air ducts.
